result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A Clayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cash bail of $250 to be applied, balance of $129 to be paid within 90 days or civil judgment will be entered as penalty for non payment.

Payments can be made on-line with a MasterCard or electronic check at:  http://wcca.wicourts.gov  (Read the agreement, the click "I agree," then click "Pay fees on-line.")  OR you may contact the Waukesha County Clerk of Courts Business Center at 262-548-7497.

03:07 PM Defendant Todd A Clayton in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Todd A Clayton appeared by video means with Attorney.  

Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

Court orders a fine of $379.00.  

Cash bail to be applied, balance to be paid within 90 days or civil judgment will be entered as penalty for non payment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 23, 2020 at 03:00 pm.
